title: Generation and Purification of pTXB1.Tn5

source.description:

following addgene suggested protocol.
https://www.addgene.org/mol-bio-reference/#antibiotics

Freshly streak out a LB agarose plates with
from the glycerol stock. Allow to grow overnight at
in an incubator.

).

in a cryovial tube as described in

.

indefinitely.

Pick a single colony to inoculate

overnight.

Add 2mL inoculum (expanded liquid colony) to
in a 2 L capacity Erlenmeyer flask.
Select single colony with a sterile pipette tip and grow out colony in liquid LB with

overnight.
Extract plasmid using Qiagen Miniprep spin column following manufacturer's instructions.
Transform T7 Express LysY(NEB C3031) cells with extracted plasmid.

source.body: We found no difference in temperature ranges from 18C to 22C during induction.

source.body:
Add PEI solution very slowly, dropwise down sides of beaker by a transfer pipette.
Solution will become cloudy.
Do not precipitate DNA too quickly.

source.description:
Aliquot
supernatant for future protein gel to check induction and purity.
Pour remaining supernatant (henceforth called Tn5 lysate) into clean 500 ml beaker on ice.
Bring volume up to
ice cold HEGX Buffer.

source.title: Day 4: Cell Pelleting and Protein Extraction

source.description:
Chitin Column preparation and loading Tn5 lysate:
Clamp column on a stand in cold room for gravity flow.

source.body:
Column type: Kimble-Chase Flex-Column Economy Columns with two 3-way valve stop-cocks
We've been using a 30cm (1 cm ID) column which enables you to add 24 mls volume during elution.

source.title: Day 4: Cell Pelleting and Protein Extraction

source.description:
Add
of Chitin resin using 10 ml serological pipet to column and allow resin to settle and pack on bottom of column

source.title: Day 4: Cell Pelleting and Protein Extraction

source.description:
Equilibrate resin with
of HEGX by gravity flow. Discard flow through.

source.title: Day 4: Cell Pelleting and Protein Extraction

source.description:
Load
of Tn5 Lysate by gravity flow over column.
SAVE this flow through for future protein gel to check induction and purity.

source.title: Day 4: Cell Pelleting and Protein Extraction

source.description:
Once all protein solution is loaded on column, wash column with
HEGX by gravity flow. Discard any flow through.

Elution continued:
Collect
of flow through from column.

Dialyze against
of Dialysis buffer for
to
in a cold room.4

source.body: We use a Slide-a-Lyzer G2 cassettes with 10 KDa cutoff (ThermoFisher, No. 87731).

source.description:
Exchange buffer with
of fresh dialysis buffer and dialyze overnight.
Measure O.D.280. It should be about 4.0.

Aliquot
supernatant for future protein gel to check induction and purity.
Run an SDS-PAGE gel following manufacturer's instruction on aliquots from steps 20, 23, 27 and 34 to check purity, and induction.

After dialysis, add approximately
of sterile 100% glycerol to bring final concentration of glycerol to 55% (for approx. 15 ml final volume).
Aliquot in cryotubes and freeze at
. Protein is good for at least 1 year with proper storage.

description:
Generation of Tn5 transposome, protein purification and loading for the sci- family of protocols.
Protein purification of pTXB1.Tn5 transformed into T7 Express LysY (NEB C3031) cells;
reference is PTXB1-Tn5 Addgene #60240 from Picelli et al. Genome Res. 2014.''
This protocol is built largely off of work described in
Picelli, Simone, et al. "Tn5 transposase and tagmentation procedures for massively scaled sequencing projects." Genome research 24.12 (2014): 2033-2040.
